data.title: Local pub
data.text: This is a local pub across the street from the Rialto Theatre.  Often live music.  Regular pub grub and drinks.  Nice atmosphere in a small room.  Don't come looking for anything fancy, but a friendly place that's not a chain and close to Harrah's Casino.

data.title: Go early
data.text: If you plan on lunch go before 12pm, place is a little small and can fill up fast.  Try the burger - they are amazing.

data.title: Decent food for a decent price
data.text: We recently went here for dinner and it was our first visit. We went with another couple who frequen this place. We were all happy with our meals. I ordered the double grilled cheese and I thought it meant double cheese but no it actually was 2 sandwiches in 1! Very tasty.  The service was good too. All the sandwiches came with either their side of the day or their cheesy hashbrown caserole which I thought was a nice option but the taste was not there. The caserole was ok but no where near as good as mine is, it is way too peppery and you can't even taste the cheese in it and no crunchies on top!

data.title: Music, beer, interesting people, good food.
data.text: I've been there many times for live music or just for a beer and to meet friends. Always have had a great time - whether it's a quiet, uncrowded night or a real busy night for a live show. Most recently was there for a Chicago Farmer show on May 21. Cody was excellent, played quite a few different songs from previous shows - all great. He ended the night in the middle of the bar playing acoustic, turned the whole place into basically a sing along. The owners Mike and Cathy are usually there and are always friendly. Can't say enough about this place. The crowd is a variety of regulars, musicians, beer and whiskey drinkers, and earlier in the night even families eating dinner (good pub food). But most are interesting to talk to. Love the live music options this place brings in every week.

data.title: friendly service good comfort food
data.text: good comfort food and what a friendly staff! can't beat the burgers! I have been there 5 times and all visits were excellent, I have done carry out and food well prepared as ordered. I recommend for the best downtown Joliet sandwich place!

data.title: Stay away
data.text:
I love to support local businesses and leave positive reviews. I have nothing positive to say about this place. I was there with a large group of people and we spent a large amount of money. In our group we had 2 people with disabilities, invisible disabilities. For example, muscular sclerosis. Instead of being treated like paying customers we were treated like we were degenerates. I encourage you not to spend your hard earned money here. Support other local businesses that will appreciate you and treat you with respect. 
This short review doesn't begin to scratch the surface.

data.title: Good Food, Great Music
data.text:
My wife and I have been to the Rialto Theater many times but were not aware that this restaurant existed even though it is just down the street. My music teacher said he was going to be playing there with his bluegrass band so we decide to go with two of our friends, listen to him and try the food.

The place is not huge consisting of an open room with a bar on one side, a stage in front, and tables in the middle and along the wall opposite the bar.  We were there on a Saturday night but it was not crowded and we sat down right away.  If there is something going on at the Rialto you may not get seated as quickly.

Our waitress came over as soon as we sat down asking us what time it was. That seemed a bit strange but she explained that the half price appetizers ended at 8pm so she wanted to see if we made the deadline. I showed her my watch and it was 20 seconds before 8 so we beat the clock. We decided to try the nachos and got the ½ plate which was plenty for four people.   

We all ordered something different and thought the food was excellent.  Check out the menu on-line. There are a lot of burgers and sandwiches but also many other choices. Just don’t  expect to get a steak or entrees that you may find in a larger restaurant.
We will definitely be back. The items on the menu are reasonably priced; the food is great as is the service. We really enjoyed the music.  You can go online to see their entertainment schedule.

data.title: Good food, great beer selection
data.text: Food is good and the selection of beers is great.  I recommend the Tribes beer.  They had open mic night which was a pleasant surprise.  Great atmosphere,

data.title: Great place near Rialto Theater
data.text: Had a great burger here with a beer prior to show at Rialto. Service was very good, prices also good!

data.title: Ignore the Looks - Come for the Food and Array of Beers on Tap
data.text:
If you walk into this place, you will be perplexed.  The ceiling has a drop tin ceiling, with nice cut glass fixtured and sconces on the north wall.  The tables and bar, look like tables and a bar you'd find in a bar.

Hidden in the back of this place is a pretty darn good kitchen.  We came in on a Monday night, and decided to try this place out.  We were greeted promptly, provided with a beer menu (a BEER MENU!  YAY!) and a food menu, and offered a glass of water while we made our selections.

The beer menu had a grunch of beers on tap.   My wife (not a liker of beer) went with their Cinderboys First Press Apple Ale, and I tried out the Shiner Okotoberfest.  Both were pretty tasty.

For dinner, we opted for the portabella sandwich, and their Tuna Steak Sandwich.  Y.U.M.  For the Tuna Steak Sandwich, I ordered it seared, which is how it was served.  Try to take small bites - just try for heaven's sake, so you can taste how good it is.  I tried and failed.  It was good.

We both opted for their Cheezy Potato side, which was a small crock of finely sliced (think hash brown sliced) potatos in a rich cheese sauce.

The check was the best part - really good food, two drinks, and less than $30.  This is worth the trip - street parking is available, otherwise there is a parking garage in the area.

data.title: Great food and craft beers
data.text: Chicago Street is a great place to stop for a quick bite before a show at the Beautiful Rialto Theater just across the street. it is usually crowded so get there early. They have fabulous fish and chips, corned beef sandwiches, and cheesy potatoes. We have never had a bad meal here and the prices are extremely reasonable. They have entertainment on the weekends and I believe an open mike night during the week. Highly recommend this place!

data.title: Decent Pub Food
data.text: The atmosphere in this place is pretty cool, but the food is your fairly average pub food. Nothing really to wow you over, but not bad either. I was impressed that they used fresh basil on the bruschetta chicken sandwich. Overall it wasn't a bad dinner.

data.title: Good food - fun atmosphere
data.text: Great value and good bar fare food. Great selection of beer and overall the crowd was local and very friendly.

data.title: Great Place to Go Before/After Show at the Rialto Square Theater
data.text: Had tickets for a show at the Rialto and wanted to grab a bite to eat before the show.  We stumbled upon Chicago Street Bar & Grill (literally down the street from the theater), and very glad we did.  It's a small establishment with a bar and maybe 20 tables.  We had to seat ourselves, but we also had to wait for a table to open up.  One of the servers came by and said she'd keep an eye open for when some patrons might be leaving.  Sure enough, 5 minutes later we had a table.  We had the fries with pulled pork and cheese as an appetizer.  I'd go back again just for that.  Everyone in our group had a burger and no one was disappointed.  You absolutely must try the beer battered fries.  That was a first for me and they were quite yummy.  The service was very good considering the place was packed with theater goers and the after-work crowd.  Staff was pleasant and attentive.  I highly recommend Chicago Street Bar & Grill.  We will definitely go back.

data.title: A Must!!!
data.text: The service is great.  The food is fabulous!  The entertainment will definitely keep you coming back. So many beers to choose from!

data.title: Wings to die for
data.text: Order the Bourbon wings and a flight of beers.  You will be amazed at the flavor and the selection of beers will leave you wanting more, more, and more.

data.title: Fish and chips
data.text:
The fish and chips need to be renamed the guppy and many FRIES FOR $8.00 is very disappointing.
But good entertainment at this little joint!

data.title: Pleasantly surprised.
data.text: Was going to a concert nearby and we needed to eat so we stopped in here. It was surprisingly good. There were plenty of choices on the menu and not too expensive. The server was pleasant and fast. They had two dollar glasses of beer and when the food arrived it was hot. Will definitely come back if we are in town again.

data.title: Nice find, good food
data.text: Found this little spot across from the Rialto Square Theater.  Very friendly service, and they were really hopping.  Food was very good (very good burger) and price was good.  Had a long list of beers available, though we didn't order any.  I would recommend if you're going to the theater or in Joliet for a stay, give it a shot.

data.title: Best Beer Selection in Town
data.text: Beer lovers delight.  The Chicago Street Pub has the coolest beer selection in Joliet.  They must have 18 or 20 taps and keep changing the selection, so you always can try a new beer.  I have been there 5 or 6 times this year and always find a beer on tap that I have not had before.  Great live original music several nights each week too.
